intro: Veronica tauricola, commonly known as the Tauric speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the Crimean Peninsula. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
